physDesc.p: This letter is two pages long. The words “Poetry (Monroe) are written in pencil in the top center of the first page. “Page 2” is typewritten in the top left corner of the second page.

div.p: I have just this minute received your letter, forwarded from Brookline.

As to your suggestions for my contributions to the Anthology, I am quite satisfied with "1777" for my second contribution (I certainly want "Patterns" for my first). If you do not care for "1777", I would suggest that you quote "Malmaison", which appears in the current number of "The Little Review". Personally I think it one of the very best things I have ever done, and Mr. Marsh thinks it the very best. It is in polyphonic prose, which I know you do not care for, and it is seven pages, which is exactly what "1777" is in my typewritten sheets. If, however, you prefer "1777" to "Malmaison", I would keep it. I certainly do not want to get rid of "1777" for any of the other poems you suggest in its place.
"Apology" is a little out of key, I think, but it is a good poem of its kind, and people like it. And I think if you put it at the very end of the group it will not clash, as it does in the middle.

The poem here which I care least about it "The Painter on Silk". If you care to substitute for that either "The Captured Goddess" or "Chinoiseries" — which is in the current number of “Others”, I should prefer it. I do not suggest "Clear, With Light Variable Winds" in that place, as I think it has a certain resemblance to "Patterns"; and I think either "The Captured Goddess" or "Chinoiseries" would be better. My group in that case will stand:
div.list:
Patterns 1777 or Malmaison Venus Transiens
A Lady The Painter On Silk — or The Captured Goddess, or Chinoiseries Solitaire A Gift <title key="redSlippers” level="a">Red Slippers Apology
div.p: This suits me perfectly, and I leave you to choose which of the alternatives you will take, always provided you take these and no others.

I enclose my article on Mrs. Aldis's "Flashlights", which I trust is short enough for you. If not, send it back, and I will shorten it. But as you always put quotations in smaller prints, I think it will come in the space you want.
When is the Anthology coming out — this Autumn?
